text: We tested multiple models,

and what we found was the
Amazon Bedrock product

was 78% more cost-effective
for our use case
than other popular models in play today.
Within Amazon Bedrock,
we use four different models today

because our solution is based
on a multi-model approach.
We select the best model

for the specific use case that
we have at the best price.
We work closely with the Bedrock team,

and I can tell you that
the number of services
that we have used,

the number of ML models that
we have been able to validate
with fine-tuning and with RAG,
I don't think it was possible
without a managed service like Bedrock.
Amazon Bedrock gave us

sort of multiple foundational
models which we could use,
and those foundational models

allowed us to sort of
approach different problems.
We've started exploring, working,

building on top of Retrieval
Augmented Generation
for our upcoming Q&A feature

where you can actually
ask your data questions,
get answers back,
and we're excited for that

and many more things
come from Amazon Bedrock.
